etymology.description: 检(檢) (jiǎn, "inspect") and 查(查) (chá, "investigate"). 检(檢) (jiǎn, "inspect") suggests a thorough examination, while 查(查) (chá, "investigate") implies looking into details or verifying information.
etymology.interpretation: In combination, 检查(檢查) (jiǎnchá, "to examine") conveys the action of thoroughly inspecting and investigating to ensure correctness or detect errors.

examples.chinese: 医生会检查身体(醫生會檢查身體)，确保健康(確保健康)。
examples.pinyin: Yīshēng huì jiǎnchá shēntǐ, quèbǎo jiànkāng.
examples.english: The doctor will examine the body to ensure health.

examples.chinese: 他每周检查电脑(他每週檢查電腦)，检查汽车(檢查汽車)。
examples.pinyin: Tā měi zhōu jiǎnchá diànnǎo, jiǎnchá qìchē.
examples.english: He examines the computer and the car every week.

examples.chinese: 老师检查练习(老師檢查練習)。
